result.execSummary:
The defendant Mariol Earl Dixon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
1 year initial confinement.   295 days credit.    Concurrent to any sentence currently serving.    DEF eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Concurrent with: Concurrent to any sentence currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: No Contact with  M.L.H.  dob:  9-3-1979  unless approved by DOC agent.

$518.00  including DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.  If probation / supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mariol Earl Dixon

records.addlTxt:
1:40 PM Defendant Mariol Earl Dixon appeared by video, in custody from Jackson Correctional Facility.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Mariol Earl Dixon.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   Court addresses DEF as to right to appear in person, DEF choses to continue by video.   Plea Questionnaire electronically submitted to Court.  State recites agreement, All parties agree.  Court reviews the information,  DEF enters Guilty plea to Count 1.  Court 2 dismissed and read in.  DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.   Court accepts plea and finds DEF guilty to Count 1.    State makes statement prior to sentencing.  Court finds Victim Rights Legislation has been complied with.   Attny Chapman makes statement prior to sentencing.  DEF makes statement.  Court follow agreement.  

COURT:  2 years prison.  1 year initial confinement.   295 days credit.    Concurrent to any sentence currently serving.  1 years extended supervision.   Conditions of extended supervision.  No Contact with  M.L.H.  dob:  9-3-1979  unless approved by DOC agent. Court Costs.  DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.    DEF eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attny Chapman to make arrangements with Dodge for appearance of DEF.

Status conference on May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:42 PM Defendant Mariol Earl Dixon in court with attorney Christian J Ness.  Defendant Mariol Earl Dixon in custody appears by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances. Attny Ness  acknowledges information, waives reading.  DEF enters NG plea.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.  Attny Ness request status.  Status conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:29 AM Defendant Mariol Earl Dixon in court with attorney Christian J Ness appears by video.  Defendant Mariol Earl Dixon in custody appears by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Ness indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.   State calls witness Sawyer County Deputy Matthew Jefson, sworn in by court.  State begins examination.  11:34 AM Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State tenders witness.  11:34 AM Cross-Examination by Attorney Ness.   11:35 AM  State makes Objection, Revelance - Court sustained.  Attny Ness no further questions.  11:36 AM  Witness excused.   No further witness.   State request for bind over.  Attny Ness no arguement.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  

Attny Ness filed bond modification request, and makes argument.   State makes statement for bond.   Court makes statement regarding bond.    Court denies bond motion.  Arraignment scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on January 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.

09:05 AM Defendant Mariol Earl Dixon in court with attorney Alysja Otten(special appearance).  Defendant Mariol Earl Dixon in custody appears by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court reporter appears by zoom.    DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Through Counsel DEF request preliminary hearing to be set within time limits.   Counsel enters NG Plea to Count 2.   Bond Continues.   Off the Record for scheduling.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
